name: Jaime L. Garcia
text: For me, that's a false. Note that being a 'good' programmer is something else though. In addition, what is 'good' here is also subjective.    I've always thought that, in general, if people can give instructions, and follow them, they can be programmers in their own right.    Ask someone to describe how a traffic light works in great detail, and you'll be surprised - people in a non-it profession who answer that will be pseudocoding already, and not realize it. (You can also use a cooking recipe as an example, if you so wish - that's technically a program too!)
